page.title: 01CUMBERNAULD, DUNBARTONSHIRE.
page.content: THIS AREA IS SPLIT BETWEEN THE DENSE URBAN AREA OF CUMBERNAULD NEW TOWN (DESIGNATED 1955) AND AREAS OF OPEN COUNTRY DOMINATED BY LIVESTOCK FARMING. CUMBERNAULD (POPULATION 50000) DOMINATES THE SURVEY AREA.THE POPULATION OF THE 12 SQUARE Km. BLOCK IS UNLIKELY TO EXCEED 8000 PERSONS MOST OF WHOM ARE CONCENTRATED IN CUMBERNAULD AND THE VILLAGE OF LUGGIEBANK. SCATTERED FARMS MAY BE FOUND OVER MUCH OF THE SURVEY AREA. HABITATION VIRTUALLY CEASES TO THE EAST OF THE AREA SINCE THE PEAT DEPOSITS OF THIS PART OF THE SLAMMANNAN PLATEAU RENDERS BUILDING AND FARMING DIFFICULT. THE AREA FALLS FIRMLY WITHIN THE SPHERE OF INFLUENCE OF GLASGOW WITH MANY OF THE POPULATION BEING OF GLASGOW EXTRACTION.TO THE IMMEDIATE EAST, FALKIRK BECOMES DOMINANT.
